Just to point out.  It is possible to owe money on stocks you buy (not short) if you buy on margin.  For instance you can use 10,000 to buy 20,000 in stock.

I feel the need to point out that this isn't how investing works. Unless you are shorting stocks (betting against), you can't lost more than you invested. If you buy 1 share for $100 dollars, all you can lose is that $100. 

If you are shorting a stock, you can lose more money than you invested because what you are doing is borrowing someone else's stock to sell because you think the price will go down and you can buy it back for less than what you sold it. This however wouldn't make sense in this story as a market crash would have been good for her in this case.
